title: Czech Republic: Citibank Introduces CitiPlanner, A New Client Platform for Investments
summary: Prague - As of November 2011 Citibank's clients can use a new client investment platform CitiPlanner that globally unites Citibank's approach to investment banking for retail clients. CitiPlanner is based on the principles of an open architecture, enabling to create client's portfolio composed from a wide offer of investment products.
tag-1: Czech Republic: Citibank Introduces CitiPlanner, A New Client Platform for Investments
tag-3: Prague – As of November 2011 Citibank's clients can use a new client investment platform CitiPlanner that globally unites Citibank's approach to investment banking for retail clients. CitiPlanner is based on the principles of an open architecture, enabling to create client's portfolio composed from a wide offer of investment products.
tag-4: "We believe that, in addition to being an understandable investment portfolio offer, our clients will also appreciate the complex investment consultancy that is based on Citibank's long-term and global experience in the area of investments," says Petr Rehák, Retail Bank Head at Citibank. "CitiPlanner offers 48 basic investment portfolios, including the opportunity for expansion in compliance with client's risk profile, personal goals and selected investment strategy."
tag-5: So called "top-pick" funds are a part of each portfolio, represented by the best funds in the given asset class in basic portfolio. All these funds have passed through a selection process within Citibank.
tag-6: "CitiPlanner offers the most suitable composition of investment portfolio to all types of clients – from the very conservative ones to the ones accepting higher risks. Everything is based on client's risk profile, i.e. readiness to risk, an investment horizon, investment goals and client's knowledge and experience in the area of investments," adds Petr Rehák.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
